title: Percko posture shirt review: moobs are a small price to pay for a better back
text:
When Alexis Ucko and Quentin Perraudeau, two French engineering graduates, launched a Kickstarter campaign for what they believed could be the answer to one of the modern world’s most widespread problems, the response was probably greater than they could have dreamt. Aiming to raise €40,000 to build a prototype posture-improving shirt, dubbed the Percko and inspired by Ucko's father’s battle with back pain, they burst through the target within seven hours. A month later they had raised £500,000.

If that sounds like a lot of money, then it's worth noting that it's not an anomaly, or even an outlier. UPRIGHT GO, another posture-correcting gizmo, received $1 million from a crowdfunding campaign...
